ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson couldn t help but rest his forehead in his left hand, closing his optics for a moment, then re opening them.  Please excuse me, I fully agree with you

Tucson couldn't help but rest his forehead in his left hand, closing his op=
tics for a moment, then re opening them.

" Please excuse me, I fully agree=
 with you Leo Prime, I was listening to you.  You're right, I do need a few=
 more hours in CR.  Quickstride, Legacy is your best bet for engineering pu=
rposes, he can help you with research, development and construction.  What =
you're proposing seems a bit complex, and it's always good to have someone =
else with you to collaborate with."

Quickstride nods enthusiastically.

" =
I was hoping ta have his support actually, well do.  There's a few things I=
 need ta sort out as far as materials.. And of course design and functionab=
ility.  "

Tucson smiles gently and then turns to the little green mech.

"=
 I assure you that if you assist us in locating the escaped predicons, you =
will be granted immunity from enemy forces."

He then turns to Leo Prime.  =


" I have a feeling Hydras may take advantage of the situation and attempt=
 another assault on this parameter.  Be sure our boundaries are well guarde=
d around the clock, and have everyone take turns running guard duty."

He n=
ods as a signal that things were adjourned for the time being.  

" That pr=
etty much covers everything, Leo Prime, thank you."

He tries to get up fro=
m his seat and stumbles.  Quickstride catches him.

" Whoa, careful sir.  L=
eo, better call someone for transport to the CR chambers, his balance is re=
ally messed up."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Jul 21,=
 2011, at 2:14 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

>> <OLD=
>
>> 
>> Tucson nods in agreement.
>> 
>> " Very well Leo Prime.  Quickstri=
de will head the construction of the wind
>> and hydro turbines.  Anyone wh=
o wishes to be on that team, report to
>> Quickstride for instruction.   As=
 for Cheetor, I'm afraid he has yet to be
>> found.  Nightshift and Rattrap=
 did all they could to search for him, and I
>> do believe Nightshift is se=
verely damaged and will need immediate repairs."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> LEO PRIME =
nodded, =E2=80=9CQuickstride will head that team. Coordinate with
> Legacy =
on that as well. He is primarily the Ark=E2=80=99s guardian and has
> been =
effecting repairs for some time. His knowledge of science and
> general eng=
ineering seems to be off the charts.
> 
>> <OLD>
>> 
>> Straight Shot sits =
up and looks to Leo Prime.
>> 
>> "He's not listening to me.  Maybe he'll l=
isten to you.  He's already taken
>> more of his share of hard hits and if =
he thinks he's gonna go out there and
>> do it all again, he's flipped a mi=
crochip or two. "
>> 
>> Tucson directs his attention over to Straight Shot=
.
>> 
>> " I know, I know, you have every right to not approve of my action=
s, but I
>> failed this faction once, I will not fail it again."
>> 
>> Str=
aight Shot swallows hard as a tear trickles down her right eye.
>> 
>> " No=
, what happened back then wasn't your fault.  None of it was.  Leo he's
>> =
blaming himself for what happened to Rodimus and the others on himself.  He=

>> thinks that if he had just been a little more careful, he could've prev=
ented
>> Hydras from winning that battle.  But it wasn't his fault.  I was =
in his cab
>> with him as an on board scout, looking out for possible ambus=
h.  I saw
>> someone in the skies far off behind us and I froze because he =
moved in
>> really fast.  By the time Cyclonus moved in for the shot, I cou=
ld barely say
>> anything.  I was terrified.  Then that's when it happened.=
  I don't remember
>> too much after that but he was not the bot who failed=
 the faction, I was.
>> And there isn't a day that goes by without me being=
 reminded of that costly
>> error I made out on that battle field."
>> 
>> =
Tucson moves over to his sister and puts a hand on her shoulder.
>> 
>> " N=
o, that was never your fault.  It was mine.  I should have never asked
>> y=
ou toventure out with me on such a dangerous mission."
>> 
>> He then looks=
 to everyone.
>> 
>> " Times are about to get difficult.  In order to win t=
he battle ahead we
>> have to work together, and we need to remain strong. =
 We will overcome as we
>> have for centuries.  Freedom is the right for al=
l sentient beings.  Now let
>> us win it, for this planet, for us and for P=
rimus."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> There is a look from LEO PRIME as he watches the sc=
ene unfold. =E2=80=9CYou do
> look like you need more time in the CR chambe=
r before you can resume
> full duty status Tuscon.=E2=80=9D LEO said soberl=
y.
> 
> LORD ELDER, who had just walked into the room nodded as he walked
>=
 straight up the middle isle. =E2=80=9CYep, Tuscon is known for trying to p=
ush
> himself too hard. If he balks too much, perhaps I can get Santon over=

> there to give him a sedative.=E2=80=9D ELDER pointed at the bulky medic =
who
> was sitting on the stage.
> 
> Although LORD ELDER was being a bit fa=
cetious SANTON nodded grimly as
> he looked over at TUSCON, =E2=80=9CYes, r=
est would be the order of the door.
> And a few more hours in the CR.=E2=80=
=9D
> 
>> <OLD>
>> 
>> Tucson puts an arm around Talon with a playful smile=
 on his face.  It would
>> be his only moment of light heartedness.
>> 
>> =
" You're absolutely right, Talon but it's a shame that CR chambers are only=

>> designed for one individual at a time."
>> 
>> He wispers quietly with =
a cat like grin on his face.  He then turns to Leo
>> Prime, with an attent=
ive nod.
>> 
>> "Nightshift and Rattrap were out looking for Cheetor togeth=
er but, an
>> unknown insectile force attacked them and in an effort to elu=
de them,
>> Nightshift spun out and collided with something in the forest w=
hich caused
>> extensive damage.  He should be in med bay now."
>> 
>> Ratt=
rap takes his seat.
>> 
>> "Sorry I'm late Wheels, I had ta help Ramulus ge=
t Nightshift inta the med
>> bay."
>> 
>> Tucson nods.
>> 
>> "That's all r=
ight, I understand.  Now as far as the escaped enemy forces,
>> I'd like to=
 send Silverbolt with Kup to the ship's parameter to see if you
>> pick up =
on their signatures.  Once they've determined the path of the
>> escaped pr=
edicons, I'd like a full report and please, try not to take them
>> on your=
 own.  Call for backup the minute you find them.  I worry about all
>> of y=
ou, and if Anything ever happened to anyone of you, I'd never forgive
>> my=
self.  "
>> 
>> He sighs.
>> 
>> " No one has the right to control what isn=
't theirs to govern.  Freedom is
>> the right of all sentient beings and th=
e right of creatures who were born
>> Naturally to this planet.  Leo Prime,=
 I vote we take care of the perpetrator
>> together.  He seems to need a ta=
ste of his own medicine."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> LEO PRIME nodded again, =E2=80=9C=
And perhaps this mech here.=E2=80=9D He pointed to
> the green mech that ha=
d the predacon IFF signal, =E2=80=9CCould help you with
> locating the ship=
 and finding survivors.=E2=80=9D
> 
> Looking back at TUSCON and then LORD =
ELDER as well as a few others LEO
> intoned. =E2=80=9CDoes anyone have anyt=
hing else to add before I dismiss the
> meeting?=E2=80=9D
